docs.lead_paragraph: " ONCE upon a time adults used to be very comfortable with children. Fathers, mothers, teachers and nannies knew intuitively that they were both guardians and authorities. They assumed ownership, loved and felt responsible, directed and corrected, instructed and insisted, praised and reproved with an ease and certainty that this was their duty.
